intro: Cerinthe aperta, commonly known as the open cerinthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cerinthe aperta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
